intro: Eliokarmos caudatum, commonly known as the long-tailed elokarmos, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of hair to reduce water loss. Eliokarmos caudatum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
